title: Simple examples
text: can select two palettes moment: palette_netflyx palette_anime. palette list series. palette package total 6 colors. function serie_palette can select palette following entry: serie_palette( enter name, palette preference, number colors, type discrete continous ) palette estructure looks similar : Let’s see examples using ggplot2 based R Graph Gallery examples.

title: Simple examples
code: # Libraries library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(Rseries)  # create a dataset data <- data.frame(   name=c( rep("A",500), rep("B",500), rep("B",500), rep("C",20), rep('D', 100)),   value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) ) )  # Plot pal=serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 5)  data %>%   ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +     geom_boxplot() +     scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +     theme_classic() +     theme(       legend.position="none",       plot.title = element_text(size=11)     ) +     ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +     xlab("")

title: Simple examples
code: # Libraries library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(Rseries)  pal=serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 5)  # Using the diamods dataset we can some of the palettes in our package.  # Multi density chart p1 <- ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=price,fill=cut))+   geom_density(position='stack')+   scale_fill_manual(values=(pal))+   theme_minimal() p1 # Stacked density plot p2 <- ggplot(data=diamonds, aes(x=price, group=cut, fill=cut)) +     geom_density(adjust=1.5, position="fill") +     scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +     theme_minimal() p2

title: Simple examples
code: # Libraries library(ggplot2) library(RColorBrewer)  # create a dataset set.seed(345) ngroup=30 names=paste("G_",seq(1,ngroup),sep="") DAT=data.frame()  for(i in seq(1:30)){   data=data.frame( matrix(0, ngroup , 3))   data[,1]=i   data[,2]=sample(names, nrow(data))   data[,3]=prop.table(sample( c(rep(0,113),c(1:ngroup)) ,nrow(data)))   DAT=rbind(DAT,data) } colnames(DAT)=c("Year","Group","Value") DAT=DAT[order( DAT$Year, DAT$Group) , ]  # plot pal = serie_palette("Lupin", palette_netflyx, 12) pal = colorRampPalette(pal)(ngroup) pal=pal[sample(c(1:length(pal)) , size=length(pal) ) ]  ggplot(DAT, aes(x=Year, y=Value, fill=Group )) +    geom_area(alpha=1)+   theme_bw() +   scale_fill_manual(values = pal)+   theme(     text = element_blank(),     line = element_blank(),     title = element_blank(),     legend.position="none",     panel.border = element_blank(),     panel.background = element_blank())

title: Simple examples
code: # Libraries library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(Rseries)  # create a dataset data <- data.frame(   name=c( rep("Mount Myōboku",500), rep("Kirigakure",500), rep("Kirigakure",500), rep("Konohagakure",20), rep('Sunagakure', 100)  ),   value=c( rnorm(500, 10, 5), rnorm(500, 13, 1), rnorm(500, 18, 1), rnorm(20, 25, 4), rnorm(100, 12, 1) ) )  # Plot pal=serie_palette("bolt", palette_anime, 5)  data %>%   ggplot( aes(x=name, y=value, fill=name)) +     geom_boxplot() +     scale_fill_manual(values=(pal)) +     theme_classic() +     theme(       legend.position="none",       plot.title = element_text(size=11)     ) +     ggtitle("A classic boxplot") +     xlab("")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jesus Quispe-Quispe. Author. Rodrigo Norabuena Mascaraqui. Author. Giancarlo Liñan Cuenca. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Quispe-Quispe J, Norabuena Mascaraqui R, LiÃ±Cuenca G (2022). Rseries: Title: Package download Economic data Peruvian public institutions. https://github.com/diognes/Rseries, https://diognes.github.io/Rseries/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Rseries: Title: Package to download Economic data from Peruvian public institutions},   author = {Jesus Quispe-Quispe and Rodrigo {Norabuena Mascaraqui} and Giancarlo {Liñan Cuenca}},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/diognes/Rseries, https://diognes.github.io/Rseries/}, }

title: Title: Package to download Economic data from Peruvian public institutions
text: package contains beauty palettes personalize plots style series plataforms like Netflyx, Amazon Prime local TV Latin American Countries

title: Title: Package to download Economic data from Peruvian public institutions
text: can install first version Rseries GitHub: following code just copy paste R console:
code: if(!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Diognes/Rseries") library(Rseries)

title: Complete list of palettes — palette_anime
text: Use names(palette_anime) view list palette anime names.

title: Complete list of palettes — palette_anime
code: palette_anime

title: Complete list of palettes — palette_netflyx
text: Use names(palette_netflyx) view list palette netflyx names.

title: Complete list of palettes — palette_netflyx
code: palette_netflyx

title: Series Palette Generator. — serie_palette
text: function builds palettes based popular series anime Netflix others visualmedia. selection subjectively made authors.

title: Series Palette Generator. — serie_palette
code: serie_palette(   name,   palette_color = palette_netflyx,   n,   type = c("discrete", "continuous") )

title: Series Palette Generator. — serie_palette
text: name Name color palette. Current options Netflyx Anime. palette_color list palettes use. n Number colors used. palette includes 9 colors discrete palettes. n can chosen continuous palettes. type Usage palette "continuous" "discrete". Continuous palettes interpolate three first colors palette create gradient. specified, function assumes continuous n>9 discrete n<9.
